ir.control

Class SearchHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • ir.control.SearchHandler

  • public class SearchHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    SearchHandler class, in charge of searching with the existing index. It returns a ranked list, of type WebPage. These items should contain all information necessary for printing the search results.

    By accessing the source code, the VERBOSE and DEBUG_MODE flags can be changed so as to print status messages during the run.

    Author:
    Gabriel

    • Method Detail

      • searchIndex

        public java.util.List<WebPage> searchIndex(java.lang.String queryString)
                                    throws java.io.IOException,
                                           org.apache.lucene.queryparser.classic.ParseException
        The main method to handle searching over an existing index. It receives a query and generates a ranked list of type WebPage. If there are no results, it returns an empty list.

        Additional specs: The search string is lowercased before doing the query. It's analysed with a Lucene Standard Analyzer and the search is performed using a MultiFieldQueryParser, over the code, title and content sections of the index entries.

        Parameters:
        queryString - A string containing the query.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        org.apache.lucene.queryparser.classic.ParseException
